data.title: Fancyclopedia 3
data.text:
A small press founded by George Scithers in 1973. Owlswick published a variety of books through 1993.

1973 -- Al Azif (an edition of the Necronomicon)

1974 -- Cities & Scenes from the Ancient World (art of Roy G. Krenkel)

1975 -- Science-Fiction Handbook, Revised: A Guide to Writing Imaginative Literature (by L. Sprague de Camp and Catherine Crook de Camp)

1976 -- Tales of Three Hemispheres (stories by Lord Dunsany)

1976 -- To Serve Man: A Cookbook for People by Karl Wirf

1977 -- The Tritonian Ring (a novel by L. Sprague de Camp)

1978 -- Tales from Gavagan's Bar/ (stories by L. Sprague de Camp and Fletcher Pratt)

1979 -- A Dreamer's Tales stories by Lord Dunsany)

1980 -- The Ragged Edge of Science (non-fiction by L. Sprague de Camp)

1980 -- The Ghosts of the Heaviside Layer and Other Fantasms (stories by Lord Dunsany)

1980 -- Teaching Science Fiction: Education for Tomorrow by Jack Williamson

1980 -- Spirits, Stars and Spells: The Profits and Perils of Magic by Catherine Crook de Camp and L. Sprague de Camp

1980 -- Science Fiction Writer's Workshop - I by Barry B. Longyear

1981 -- On Writing Science Fiction (The Editors Strike Back!) by John M. Ford, Darrell Schweitzer and George H. Scithers

1982 The Hand of Zei (a novel by L. Sprague de Camp)

1984 -- Burning With A Vision: Poetry of Science and the Fantastic ed by Robert Frazier

1988 -- The Devil's Auction by Robert Weinberg

1989 -- Pathways to Elfland: The Writings of Lord Dunsany (essays by Darrell Schweitzer)

1990 -- The White Isle (a novel by Darrell Schweitzer)

1990 -- Anita (stories by Keith Roberts)

1990 -- The Infinite Kingdoms (by Michael Rutherford)

1991 -- The Adventures of Doctor Eszterhazy (stories by Avram Davidson)

1993 -- Adventures in Unhistory (essays by Avram Davidson)

Publisher 1973â€”1993
